results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Barbara O'Connell and Steven Minor
results.brief_description: Explores time as a practical force, as an abstract concept and as a measure of life. Captures the art and wizardry used over the centuries to tell time.

results.title: Once upon a time
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Central Office of Information, Maxwell Munden and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: A story of Britain’s contribution to the art of clock-making. The Greenwich Observatory was established during the reign of Charles II.; in 1764 a clock was made which would keep time for months on board ships, and so the problem of longitude was solved. Today, in the age of mass production, Britain’s clockwork industry maintains its high standards of precision and reliability.

results.title: Once upon a prime time
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: A zany spoof with plenty of violence borrowed from the very source it seeks to parody, this film is about a housewife who has lost her family to the television set. Characters spring from the screen to invade her home and take over her life. She is saved by Buck the cowboy, who shoots everyone dead and rides off with her. Sam, her husband, witnesses the departure on his TV set. Stars: Edward Allen, Paul Berval, Christien Delmas, Basil Fitzgibbon, Gilles Pellerin, Joan Stuart, John Vernon, Chris Wiggins, Trudi Wiggins, Leslie Yeo, Ted Zeigler. Written by Stan Daniels; photographed by Jean Roy and Thomas Vamos; edited by Kathleen Shannon; sound by Ron Alexander, Andre Hourlier, John Knight and Roger Lamoureux.

results.title: Once upon a mouse and other mousetime stories
results.brief_description: This video has put together a compilation of magical Disney animated cartoons in tribute to everyone’s favourite mouse, Mickey Mouse, along with other mouse stories, including Amos the church mouse in “Ben and me”. Mickey features in the Oscar nominated “Brave little tailor”. Also includes a bonus feature on the legacy of Walt Disney and the history of Walt Disney Productions using archival footage, excerpts from many of the Disney productions such as “Snow White and the seven dwarfs”, “Pinocchio”, “Lady and the Tramp”, “Peter Pan” and a brief glimpse into the beginnings of Mickey Mouse as a cartoon character.

results.title: Once upon a mouse
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Jerry Kramer and Gary Rocklen
results.brief_description: Excerpts from animated features, cartoon shorts and still photography are combined for a nostalgic montage of unusual beauty and emotional impact. The film segments a wide variety of Disney animated features, such as music, love, villains and happy endings.

results.title: Once upon a midnight scary
results.creator_credit: Diane Asselin, Paul Asselin and Neil Cox
results.brief_description: Welcome to the eerie library of Vincent Price, journey with him into a world of ghosts, ghouls and “things that go bump in the night”. The Master of macabre has conjured up a reading of classic and contemporary ghost stories that are vividly brought to life. There is mystery and wonder in these three famous tales of the supernatural. In Richard Peck’s “The Ghost Belonged to Me”, meet 13 year old Alexander, a farmboy who discovers he has his very own ghost! And see Ichabod Crane from Washington Irving’s classic “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow”, who doesn’t believe in ghosts - until the Headless Horseman takes his last ride. Then there’s John Bellair’s “The House With a Clock in its Walls”, where a doctor and his nephew race against an evil spirit to find a clock before it destroys the world.

results.title: Once upon a hunt [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Gauvreau and Francis Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: This feature film is the story of three men and a boy who leave the city for the bush and a three-day hunt. For the hunters escaping the routine of daily life and work, the hunt is a move towards freedom. And above all, it is a chance to prove their virility in conquering the wild. Their attempts end in failure and tragedy. Cast includes Monique Mercure, Francoise Berd, Marcel Sabourin, Frederique Collin, Pierre Dufresne. Preview before screening for a general audience. Dubbed English version. (Award: Toronto)

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: Hugh Stuckey, Kestrel Film Productions and John Richardson
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.

results.title: Once there were bluebirds
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications and Dick Van Bentham
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to acquaint children with the beauty of nature and the ecological problems caused by the encroachments of modern society. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: On Your Own (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Teach your children safety measures and self-care skills for times when they are home alone and show them how to confront their fears. The film stresses the need for communication between parent and child, and encourages children to view being alone as a positive, rewarding experience.
